none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on March 01, 2020 Description from Terminal Escape:
They were only an hour from Philly, so there's not really an excuse....but living in a tiny ass town still makes kids do weird things. I can't really decide if it's just the vocals that drive me batshit, or if I find the whole thing unlistenable (update: it's the former - the guitar tone is killer, and some of the songs are decent in an endearing and/or nostalgic way), but really these are the kind of historical artifacts that give credence to the argument that the '90s sucked. Sure, they're kinda fast sometimes, and there was nothing wrong with aping RANCID from time to time (it was 1997, and I'm pretty sure these kids had at least two GRIMPLE records between them), but ultimately this demo just sounds stale. Dated. Unnecessary. So riddle me this: Why do I keep listening? And the honest answer: Because I like it. Sigh. I think the word is "endearing." The guitar tone really is smoking though.  GENERATION 13

seo.title: Generation 13 - Generation 13 demo 1997 - Terminal Escape
